com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api

Class Processor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Processor

  • public abstract class Processor
extends Object
    Main class that is extended by the user's implementation.

    All of the routines defined below will be called at runtime with the following sequence:

    Conductor process

    1. Invokes Constructor of the user's implementation
    2. Invokes getCapabilities() to check whether the user's code can be run with the current job design.
    3. Invokes validateConfiguration(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Configuration, boolean) if runtime column propagation is enabled on at least one output link and getBeanForOutput(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Link) is implemented by the user's code.
    4. Invokes getConfigurationErrors() if validateConfiguration(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Configuration, boolean) returns false
    5. Invokes getBeanForOutput(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Link) for each output link whose runtime column propagation is enabled.
    6. Invokes getAdditionalOutputColumns(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Link, java.util.List<com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Link>, java.util.Properties) for each output link whose runtime column propagation is enabled.

    The following routines will be additionally called if Capabilities.setIsRunOnConductor(boolean) is called with true.

    1. Invokes validateConfiguration(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Configuration, boolean).
    2. Invokes getConfigurationErrors() if validateConfiguration(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Configuration, boolean) returns false
    3. Invokes initialize().
    4. Invokes terminate(boolean).

    Player process

    1. Invokes Constructor of the user's implementation
    2. Invokes getCapabilities() to check whether the user' code can be run with the current job design.
    3. Invokes validateConfiguration(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Configuration, boolean)
    4. Invokes getConfigurationErrors() if validateConfiguration(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Configuration, boolean) returns false
    5. Invokes getBeanForInput(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Link) for each input link.
    6. Invokes getBeanForOutput(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Link) for each output link.
    7. Invokes initialize()
    8. Invokes process() for each wave
    9. Invokes terminate(boolean)
    All of the routines defined below will be called at design-time with the following sequence:
    1. Invokes Constructor of the user's implementation
    2. Invokes getCapabilities() to check whether the user' code can be run with the current job design.
    3. Invokes getUserPropertyDefinitions() if this method is implemented by the user's code.
    4. Invokes validateConfiguration(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Configuration, boolean)
    5. Invokes getConfigurationErrors() if validateConfiguration(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Configuration, boolean) returns false
    6. Invokes getBeanForInput(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Link) for each input link if this method is implemented by the user's code.
    7. Invokes getBeanForOutput(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Link) for each output link if this method is implemented by the user's code.
    8. Invokes getColumnMetadataForInput(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Link) for each input link if the user's code does not have the corresponding getBeanForInput(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Link) method.
    9. Invokes getColumnMetadataForOutput(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Link) for each output link if the user's code does not have the corresponding getBeanForOutput(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Link) method.

    Note: The implementation is not synchronized to avoid unexpected errors due to data corruption in single-thread applications. If multiple threads access this object at the same time, it might result in undesirable effects. If this happens, synchronize calls to its methods externally.

    Version:
    1.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • Processor

        public Processor()

    • Method Detail

      • getCapabilities

        public Capabilities getCapabilities()
        Retrieves the capabilities of user's processor code. This method is intended to be overridden in a subclass of Processor. null indicates default capabilities will be used.

        A default implementation is provided that returns null(default capabilities).

      • getBeanForInput

        public Class<?> getBeanForInput(Link inputLink)
        Implementation returns the bean class corresponding to inputLink. This method is intended to be overridden in a subclass of Processor if JavaBean is used.

        A default implementation is provided that returns null.

        Parameters:
        inputLink - Link
        Returns:
        A Class of bean class.

      • getBeanForOutput

        public Class<?> getBeanForOutput(Link outputLink)
        Implementation returns the bean class corresponding to outputLink. This method is intended to be overridden in a subclass of Processor if JavaBean is used.

        A default implementation is provided that returns null.

        Parameters:
        outputLink - Link
        Returns:
        A Class of bean class.

      • getColumnMetadataForInput

        public List<ColumnMetadata> getColumnMetadataForInput(Link inputLink)
                                               throws Exception
        Implementation returns a set of ColumnMetadata objects corresponding to a given inputLink. It describes a set of columns to be imported at design-time. This method is intended to be overridden in a subclass of Processor if implementation provides metadata import functionality via Java Integration stage "Configuration" wizard. This method will not be called if implementation has the corresponding getBeanForInput(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Link) method.

        A default implementation is provided that returns null.

        Any exception that may be thrown by this method will display an error message to the user.

        Parameters:
        inputLink - Link
        Returns:
        A set of ColumnMetadata implementations.
        Throws:
        Exception - if creating a set of ColumnMetadata is failed in user's processor code.

      • getColumnMetadataForOutput

        public List<ColumnMetadata> getColumnMetadataForOutput(Link outputLink)
                                                throws Exception
        Implementation returns a set of ColumnMetadata objects corresponding to a given outputLink. It describes a set of columns to be imported at design-time. This method is intended to be overridden in a subclass of Processor if implementation provides metadata import functionality via Java Integration stage "Configuration" wizard. This method will not be called if implementation has the corresponding getBeanForOutput(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Link) method.

        A default implementation is provided that returns null.

        Any exception that may be thrown by this method will display an error message to the user.

        Parameters:
        outputLink - Link
        Returns:
        A set of ColumnMetadata implementations.
        Throws:
        Exception - if creating a set of ColumnMetadata is failed in user's processor code.

      • getUserPropertyDefinitions

        public List<PropertyDefinition> getUserPropertyDefinitions()
        Implementation returns a set of user properties for the stage. The design time environment would then display the properties to the user and allow the user to enter values.
        Returns:
        A set of PropertyDefinition objects.

      • validateConfiguration

        public abstract boolean validateConfiguration(Configuration configuration,
                            boolean isRuntime)
                                       throws Exception
        Specifies the current configuration (number and types of links), and the values for the user properties. If there are problems with the configuration or user properties, then implementation should keep an ordered list of textual errors describing the issue with the configuration for subsequently called getConfigurationErrors(), and return false. This method is called both at design time and runtime. The isRuntime informs the implementation as to whether this is design or runtime.
        Parameters:
        configuration - The current configuration(number and types of links, environment)
        isRuntime - true if runtime, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        false if found problems with the configurations. Otherwise, returns true.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • getConfigurationErrors

        public List<String> getConfigurationErrors()
        Returns an ordered list of textual errors describing the issue with the configuration. This method will be called if validateConfiguration(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Configuration, boolean) returned false. Implementation should return null if no issues are found.
        Returns:
        An ordered list of textual errors describing the issue with the configuration. Implementation should return an empty list if no issues are found.

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
                throws Exception
        Initializes the stage. This method is intended to be overridden in a subclass of Processor.

        A default implementation is provided that does nothing, therefore it is not necessary to override this method. It is called once during the lifetime of a running job, before executing job, so it can be used for setting up user's context, for example.

        Any exception that may be thrown by this method will abort the job that runs the stage. The message of the exception is logged.

        Throws:
        Exception - if initialization is failed.

      • terminate

        public void terminate(boolean isAborted)
               throws Exception
        Terminates the stage. This method is intended to be overridden in a subclass of Processor.

        A default implementation is provided that does nothing, therefore it is not necessary to override this method. It is called once, during the lifetime of a running job, right before the job ends, so it can be used for cleaning up user's context, for example.

        Any exception that may be thrown by this method will abort the job that runs the stage. The message of the exception is logged.

        Parameters:
        isAborted - true if the job execution is aborted.
        Throws:
        Exception - if termination is failed.

      • process

        public abstract void process()
                      throws Exception
        Entry point for processing records from the input link or to the output link. This method is intended to be overridden in a subclass of Processor.

        As long as a row is available on any of the stage input links (if any and whatever the number of output links is), the Java Integration stage will call the process() method, if the job does not abort.

        process() can process as many input rows as desired on each call. For example, it can simply provide a loop to perform multiple InputLink.readRecord() calls, perform appropriate processing, and write rows on the output link.

        If the stage has only output links, the Java Integration stage call the process() method once during the lifetime of a running job.

        Any exception that may be thrown by this method will abort the job that runs the stage. The message of the exception is logged.

        Throws:
        Exception - if error occurred during processing records.

      • getAdditionalOutputColumns

        public List<ColumnMetadata> getAdditionalOutputColumns(Link outputLink,
                                              List<Link> inputLinks,
                                              Properties stageProperties)
        Implementation returns a set of columns to add to the outputLink. Values returned by ColumnMetadata.getIndex() are ignored when adding columns. This method is called in the conductor node when Runtime Column Propagation is enabled.
        To add columns that have arbitrary names and data types, ColumnMetadataImpl is useful. The following is a sample code. 

         
 public List getAdditionalOutputColumns(Link outputLink, List inputLinks, Properties stageProperties)
 {
    List addtionalColumns = new ArrayList();
    ColumnMetadata charCol = new ColumnMetadataImpl("charCol", ColumnMetadata.SQL_TYPE_CHAR);
    addtionalColumns.add(charCol);
    ColumnMetadata intCol = new ColumnMetadataImpl("intCol", ColumnMetadata.SQL_TYPE_INTEGER);
    addtionalColumns.add(intCol);
    return addtionalColumns;
 }

        To add columns that are in input link 0, but not in the output link, implement this method as follows. 

         
 public List getAdditionalOutputColumns(Link outputLink, List inputLinks, Properties stageProperties)
 {
    return inputLinks.get(0).subtractColumnList(outputLink);
 }

        To propagate a value to the output column from corresponding input column, copy the value in process() method. The sample code is shown below, where _output is an OutputLink object which columns are propagated to, outputRecord is an OutputRecord object associated with _output, inputRecord is an InputRecord object which columns are propagated from, colName is name of a column to propagate. 

         
 if (_output.isRcpEnabled())
 {
    outputRecord.setValue(colName, inputRecord.getValue(colName));
 }

        Parameters:
        outputLink - The Link object associated with the output link which the colums are added to.
        inputLinks - An ordered list of Link objects associated with input links connected to this stage.
        stageProperties - A set of user properties for the stage.
        Returns:
        An ordered list of ColumnMetadata objects to add to the outputLink. If null or an empty list is returned, no column is added.
